title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {metricminer: Mine Metrics from Common Places on the Web},   author = {Candace Savonen and Howard Baek},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/fhdsl/metricminer}, }

title: Get all metrics for all properties associated with an account — all_ga_metrics

title: Get all metrics for all properties associated with an account — all_ga_metrics
code: if (FALSE) {  authorize("google") accounts <- get_ga_user()  stats_list <- all_ga_metrics(account_id = accounts$id[5]) saveRDS(stats_list, "itcr_website_data.rds") }

what: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
text: function authorize metricminer access calendly, github google noninteractively passing keys tokens.

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
code: auth_from_secret(app_name, token, access_token, refresh_token, cache = FALSE)

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
text: app_name app trying authorize? 'google', 'calendly' 'github'? token calendly github, pass API key Personal Access Token set going https://github.com/settings/tokens/new https://calendly.com/integrations/api_webhooks respectively. access_token Google, access token can obtained running authorize interactively: token <-authorize(); token$credentials$access_token refresh_token Google, refresh token can obtained running authorize interactively: token <-authorize(); token$credentials$refresh_token cache credentials cached? TRUE FALSE?

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
text: OAuth token saved environment package can use users' Google data

title: Use secrets to Authorize R package to access endpoints — auth_from_secret
code: if (FALSE) {  # Example for authorizing Calendly # You go to https://calendly.com/integrations/api_webhooks to get an api key auth_from_secret("calendly", token = "A_calendly_token_here")  # Example for GitHub # You go to https://github.com/settings/tokens/new to get a Personal Access Token auth_from_secret("github", token = "ghp_a_github_pat_here")  # Example for authorizing for Google token <- authorize("google") auth_from_secret(   app_name = "google",   refresh_token = token$credentials$access_token,   access_token = token$credentials$refresh_token ) }

Handle Calendly GET requests — calendly_get
text: function handles Calendly GET requests

title: Handle Calendly GET requests — calendly_get
code: calendly_get(url, token = NULL, user = NULL, count = NULL, page_token = NULL)

title: Handle Calendly GET requests — calendly_get
text: url endpoint URL API request token can provide API key directly using argument function attempt grab API key stored using `authorize("calendly")` function user user param Calendly. Usually looks like "https://api.calendly.com/users/c208a750-9214-4c62-9ee6-a1a9507c7b43" count paginated GETs, can specify many things like returned page_token paginated GET, page ?

title: Handle Calendly GET requests — calendly_get
text: Calendly REST API response list

title: Handle Calendly GET requests — calendly_get
code: if (FALSE) {  authorize("calendly") token <- get_token(app_name = "calendly")  result_list <- calendly_get(   url = "https://api.calendly.com/users/me",   token = token ) }

text: property_id GA property. Looks like '123456789' Can obtained running `get_ga_properties()`

title: Get metadata associated Google Analytics property — get_ga_metadata
code: if (FALSE) {  authorize("google") accounts <- get_ga_user()  properties_list <- get_ga_properties(account_id = accounts$id[1])  property_id <- gsub("properties/", "", properties_list$properties$name[1]) property_metadata <- get_ga_metadata(property_id = property_id) }

what: Get stats for an associated Google Analytics property — get_ga_stats
title: Get stats for an associated Google Analytics property — get_ga_stats
text: function get Google Analytics accounts user access

title: Get stats for an associated Google Analytics property — get_ga_stats
code: get_ga_stats(   property_id,   start_date = "2015-08-14",   body_params = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   stats_type = "metrics" )

title: Get stats for an associated Google Analytics property — get_ga_stats
text: property_id GA property. Looks like '123456789' Can obtained running `get_ga_properties()` start_date YYYY-MM-DD format metric like collect metrics start. Default earliest date Google Analytics collected. body_params body parameters request end_date YYYY-MM-DD format metric like collect metrics end. Default today. stats_type want retrieve metrics dimensions?

title: Get stats for an associated Google Analytics property — get_ga_stats
code: if (FALSE) {  authorize("google") accounts <- get_ga_user()  properties_list <- get_ga_properties(account_id = accounts$id[1])  property_id <- gsub("properties/", "", properties_list$properties$name[1]) metrics <- get_ga_stats(property_id, stats_type = "metrics") dimensions <- get_ga_stats(property_id, stats_type = "dimensions") }

Get Google Forms — get_google_form
text: function get Google Form info responses API

title: Get Google Forms — get_google_form
text: form_id form ID need get token credentials access Google using OAuth. `authorize("google")` dataformat format like data? Options "raw" "dataframe". "dataframe" default.

title: Get Google Forms — get_google_form
text: returns list form info responses google form. Default make list nicely formatted dataframes.

title: Get Google Forms — get_google_form
code: if (FALSE) {  authorize("google") form_info <- get_google_form( "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Z-lMMdUyubUqIvaSXeDu1tlB7_QpNTzOk3kfzjP2Uuo/edit" )  ### OR You can give it a direct form id form_info <- get_google_form("1Z-lMMdUyubUqIvaSXeDu1tlB7_QpNTzOk3kfzjP2Uuo") }

title: Get multiple Google forms — get_multiple_forms
text: wrapper function returning google form info responses multiple forms

title: Get multiple Google forms — get_multiple_forms
text: form_ids vector form ids like retrieve information token credentials access Google using OAuth. `authorize("google")`

title: Get multiple Google forms — get_multiple_forms
text: returns list API information google forms

title: Get multiple Google forms — get_multiple_forms
code: if (FALSE) {  authorize("google") form_list <- googledrive::drive_find( shared_drive = googledrive::as_id("0AJb5Zemj0AAkUk9PVA"), type = "form")  multiple_forms <- get_multiple_forms(form_ids = form_list$id) }

title: Retrieve metrics for a list of repos — get_repos_metrics
code: if (FALSE) {  authorize("github") all_repos_metrics <- get_repos_metrics(owner = "fhdsl") readr::write_tsv(all_repos_metrics, "fhdsl_github_metrics.tsv")  repo_names <- c("fhdsl/metricminer", "jhudsl/OTTR_Template") some_repos_metrics <- get_repos_metrics(repo_names = repo_names) }
